item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1514; 08:06PM; 842 N La Cienega Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uu7scs; #BeverlyGrove; 38 LAFD Firefighters, joined in initial fire attack by jurisdictionally adjacent LACoFD responding in Automatic Aid, took just 25 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire within one first floor pizza restaurant at a two story strip mall. One civilian is being medically evaluated at scene following smoke exposure. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC5 E227 E261 E27 E41 E61 E97 RA61 RA861 T27 T61 + LACoFD Automatic Aid during initial fire attack; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1514; 07:41PM; 842 N La Cienega Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uu7scs; #BeverlyGrove; PRELIM: Two story strip mall with smoke from two units on the first floor.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC5 E227 E261 E27 E41 E61 E97 RA61 RA861 T27 T61 + LACoFD; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Update Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1099; 04:06PM; 6650 N Reseda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Lf0DBs; #Reseda; 46 Firefighters took just 18 minutes in offensive operations to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one unit at the rear (one story section) of a vacant combination one- and two-story central courtyard style commercial building. No injury. #LATraffic: Closure of one or more lanes of both north- and southbound Reseda Boulevard between Vanowen Street and Kittridge Street until LAFD operations are complete, unknown duration. Motorists: expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Bus Riders: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for any service disruption. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 CM42 E100 E273 E293 E472 E73 E90 E290 E93 EM15 RA83 RA903 T73 T90 T93; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/05/2022 INC#0672

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0672; 12:09PM; 1715 S Santa Ana Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J7qJ7W; #Watts; 76 Firefighters took just 49 minutes in offensive operations to access, confine and fully extinguish an outside vegetation fire that extended into the basement / subfloor of a large 2 story (active?) church. No injury. The specific cause of the fire is under active investigation.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; AR1 BC1 BC13 BC2 CE59 CM22 E14 E203 E21 E233 E264 E266 E33 E5 E57 EA1 EM13 PH1 RA264 RA64 RA65 RA803 RA865 T3 T33 T64 T66 T9 UR3; CH9; 13 14 15; Brian Humphrey

Update Complete - Trench Rescue; INC#0575; 11:30AM; 9031 N El Dorado Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GwFIGF; #SunValley; The second of two adult male construction workers involved in an unspecified purpose trenching project in the side yard of a single family home has been skillfully freed (in 77 minutes) by specially trained and equipped LAFD rescuers. He remains conscious and alert, and is receiving on-site medical treatment for leg injuries as he is being prepared for LAFD ambulance transport to a regional trauma center. His briefly trapped co-worker, who escaped the trench prior to LAFD arrival, is now at a regional trauma center being treated for non-life threatening leg injuries. A third person at the scene (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) later came forward with a complaint of back pain, and has been taken to an area hospital for clinical care. The "concrete slab" that fell with soil into the 4' deep trench with "makeshift shoring", trapping the men, was from a section of walkway on the private property. Media Inquiries: Cal-OSHA and L.A. Department of Building & Safety; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 BC14 CM42 E24 E260 E289 E7 E77 E88 EM14 HR3 RA7 RA77 RA88 RA889 T60 T88 T89 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0672; 11:20AM; 1715 S Santa Ana Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J7qJ7W; #Watts; PRELIM: Outside fire had extended into the basement of a two-story church on LAFD arrival.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; AR1 BC13 E21 E233 E264 E33 RA65 RA865 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Fatal Traffic Collision; INC#0646; 11:00AM; 17009 Foothill Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3gxcixn; Sylmar; One motorcycle rider (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) is deceased at scene. No other patients. One of more lanes of roadway will be closed in and near the area until LAPD and Coroner operations are complete, unknown duration. Motorists: expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #1714) and Coroner.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; E298 E91 RA91 T98; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Update Trench Rescue; INC#0575; 10:30AM; 9031 N El Dorado Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GwFIGF; #SunValley; Address corrected from Snelling Street. Two adult male construction workers were involved in an unspecified purpose trenching project in the side yard of a single family home, when the wall of a 4' deep trench that had "makeshift shoring" gave way, including soil and a concrete slab from a nearby sidewalk. One of the men escaped the trench with a leg injury prior to LAFD arrival, and is now being evaluated by paramedics. His conscious and alert co-worker remains in the trench, his leg(s) trapped by the aforementioned soil and concrete. LAFD responders, including those specially trained, certified and equipped for Urban Search and Rescue, are now at scene stabilizing the trench, providing concurrent medical care, and preparing to safely extract the trapped man. ; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 BC14 CM42 E24 E260 E289 E7 E77 E88 EM14 HR3 RA7 RA77 RA88 RA889 T60 T88 T89 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17, 18; Brian Humphrey
